docs.snippet: Instead of being back in a production truck at the World Series, Bill Webb is dealing with injuries from a fall in addition to having been battling brain cancer....
docs.lead_paragraph: Instead of being back in a production truck at the World Series, Bill Webb is dealing with injuries from a fall in addition to having been battling brain cancer.

docs.snippet: The former Title IX coordinator at Baylor University says that a top school official told her to never put anything in writing after she sent him a 16-page memo detailing her concerns that her authority and support were still being compromised eve...
docs.lead_paragraph: The former Title IX coordinator at Baylor University says that a top school official told her to never put anything in writing after she sent him a 16-page memo detailing her concerns that her authority and support were still being compromised even as the university had indicated it was trying to make changes in the wake of a series of sexual assault claims.

headline.main: Ex-Baylor Official Says Told to Not Put Anything in Writing
headline.print_headline: Ex-Baylor Official Says Told to Not Put Anything in Writing

docs.snippet: The U.S. Justice Department filed a lawsuit on Wednesday against AT&T's DirecTV, alleging it acted as a ringleader to illegally swap information with rival pay-TV providers about negotiations over showing Dodgers baseball games in the Los Ange...
docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Justice Department filed a lawsuit on Wednesday against AT&T's DirecTV, alleging it acted as a ringleader to illegally swap information with rival pay-TV providers about negotiations over showing Dodgers baseball games in the Los Angeles area.

headline.main: U.S. Sues DIRECTV for Illegal Information Trading During Dodgers Talks

docs.snippet: Sri Lanka ended Zimbabwe's day-long resistance seven overs from the end of play to grab victory by 225 runs on the final day of the first test at the Harare Sports Club on Wednesday. Zimbabwe were bowled for 186 runs in their second innings within...
docs.lead_paragraph: Sri Lanka ended Zimbabwe's day-long resistance seven overs from the end of play to grab victory by 225 runs on the final day of the first test at the Harare Sports Club on Wednesday. Zimbabwe were bowled for 186 runs in their second innings within sight of what would have been a morale boosting draw.

headline.main: Sri Lanka Beat Zimbabwe by 225 Runs in First Test
headline.print_headline: Sri Lanka Beat Zimbabwe by 225 Runs in First Test
